title:
A Hamiltonian Formulation for Energy Loss, Collision Rate, and Entropy
  Evolution in Collisionless and Collisional Plasmas: Transition from
  Maxwellian to Non-Maxwellian Distributions
abstract:
In this paper, we present a generalised Hamiltonian formulation to model the
collision rate, energy loss, entropy evolution, and the transition from
Maxwellian to non-Maxwellian distributions in a plasma. By incorporating
gyrokinetic turbulence and the effects of collisions, we derive a Hamiltonian
that captures both the collisionless and collisional dynamics of a plasma. The
formulation accounts for entropy production, energy transport, and the
resulting changes in plasma confinability. We show how entropy increase during
the transition from Maxwellian to non-Maxwellian states impacts fusion
efficiency and plasma stability. Finally, we provide a mathematical proof that
links entropy evolution to energy loss and the emergent properties of
confinement.
